entry.def: To glorify something means to praise it or make it seem good or special, usually when it is not.

example.ex: This magazine in no way glorifies gangs.
example.tran: 这本杂志绝对没有美化混混们。

example.ex: ...the banning of songs glorifying war and racism.
example.tran: 对吹捧战争和种族歧视的歌曲的禁播令

entry.def: If you glorify God, you praise Him.

example.ex: We are all committed to serving the Lord and glorifying His name in the best way we know.
example.tran: 我们全心全意敬奉上帝，竭尽所能颂扬他的美名。

means.word_mean: 2. a portrayal of something as ideal;

sentences.sentence: "the idealization of rural life was very misleading"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of glorifying (as in worship);

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,由ific变化而来,"产生,……化",通常在fy,ty结尾的动词后

stems_affixes.word_buile: ampl=ample充足的,详细的+ification产生,……化→放大后看得更加详细
glorify使更壮丽,赞扬+ification产生,……化→n.赞颂;美化
magn大+ification产生,……化→n.扩大,放大倍率
verify证实,查证的名词→n.确认,查证,作证
